description:
Nameless horrors lurk in remote places. Only the bravest dare to venture there. On the shores of New England or in the heart of an icy continent, can you unravel the mystery of the creatures that threaten our world? Join your faction, recover and play special skills to save humanity ... or sink into a nightmare! (Oh yes anyway…)

17 investigators, 17 creatures and every man for himself.

Each player randomly receives a faction card that they keep hidden and three more cards, that he can, in turn, either play or draw (within the limit of three cards in hand).

If he plays a card, he keeps it in front of himself and applies its effect.

The winner is the one who scores the most points at the end of the game, the hero cards causing the heroes to score points and lose to the villains and vice versa.

Can be combined with Ze Horror Attack game, for even more horrific monsters and characters.

—description from publisher

In Blood Orders, 2 to 4 opponents each take on the roles of powerful but disgraced vampires, exiled from a centuries-old order and hoping to build a new underground kingdom of their own in an unfamiliar city. Players visit locations in disguise to gain resources, perform arcane rituals, and hypnotize the citizenry...but most importantly, to turn hapless victims into fresh, bloodthirsty vampires under their command!

To build your new order, you must manage a continuously evolving hand of vampire cards at your command, sending them throughout the city to visit locations, perform arcane rituals, bewitch victims, and recruit new vampires, all over the course of nine rounds (days). All of these activities take the form of cards activated by your order tokens on the board, allowing you to amass critical resources, perform useful actions, and earn points. However, as your power grows, so does fear within the city, making your quest increasingly difficult as the days go by.

At the end of the ninth day, the vampire player with the most points reigns supreme!

—description from designer

Ride is an adrenaline-pumping card game inspired by the film of the same name released in September 2018. As the two protagonists of the film you will have to be able to get to the finish line safe and sound, only one of the players will win, but the collaboration to be able to reach the finish line at least alive will be essential!

Play your cards wisely, help your ally in desperate moments hoping that he too will do the same with you, under penalty of a scorching defeat by the Dark Rider!

After preparing the decks, each player chooses a Rider (or one is assigned to them at random), taking the relative Card (if it is the first game, mount the appropriate characteristic clips on the card), the Rider marker to be placed on the first card of the Path.

There are four different phases that follow each other in a precise order: Route phase, Dark Rider phase, Events phase and Rider phase.  The first essentially creates the path that the players will be required to tackle: in each Path phase, 4 cards are added in front of the leading rider and all those in the queue of the last rider will be eliminated.  If there are no tiles behind them, the first one will be eliminated and the rider on it will suffer a penalty.

In the Dark Rider phase, on the other hand, the action passes into the hands of the mysterious antagonist who will act following the action diagram shown on his card depending on the result obtained by rolling the RIDE die. It should be noted that this disturbing element will not be present immediately in the game, but will appear the first time a Rider should pass on a Path card with his symbol.

Should the Dark Rider not be present, the Events phase will take care of complicating the players' life: here a card will be drawn from the relative deck and covered place on the Path.  It will be revealed, and activated, should a player end his turn on that specific card.  Note that there is nothing to prevent different Event cards from hitting the same route segment: in this case, all effects will be applied.

In the last phase, the players can take turns taking action.  After drawing 4 cards (or less depending on certain situations) they will be forced to play one.  Therefore, according to a precise schedule they will have to: apply the indicated effect and advance by a number of Movement Points equal to, or lower than, those provided by the card.  Having determined the card on which you decide to end up, you will have to apply any reported effects, reveal and activate the Events and, if possible, fight against the other Riders.

The aim of the game will be to accumulate more points than the others and, not secondary, to stay alive.

—user summary

You and your hot air ballon have entered the "RED BALLOON" contest, where the best traveller in Turkey will be decided. To win you need to travel to the most destinations within 51 days.

On your turn you will draw 1 card from the deck on each trip day and choose a city from the opened cards. Some tickets have 2 city names, but you can only visit 1 city on the day of the trip.

Extra points are awarded for visting each region two, four, or six times.

Remember, your goal in the game is to travel to the most geographical regions in Turkey and earn the highest score.
Through careful planning and strategic choices, you can make your name as Turkey’s greatest hot air balloon adventurer.

—description from the designer

Your team, consisting of LKA profilers in training, has come a long way. Now you are facing your first real case. Your instructor will give you a file with all the evidence of a murder case.  During your hunt for the perpetrator, you will experience a multidimensional detective board game based on a true story.

As real detectives, you have to follow every lead, including cell phones and the Internet. It is therefore necessary that you have at least one internet-enabled device when playing. At The Unknown you have access to a realistic database in which you can find suspects, listen to interrogations and solve the case!

In this game you play as a team and not against each other. So nothing stands in the way of an exciting game evening!

—description from publisher

One player is selected as the "tote operator", basically the bookie.

After the players place their bets, a set of cards is used to determine the first and second place winners. The cards are viewed through another card with a window, which reveals the race results.

The money is distributed based on the bets placed.

The player with the most money at the end of the game wins.

The first horse to cross the finish line wins.

This game is a simple spin-and-move racing game. When the race starts, the spinner is used to determine which horse moves and by how much it moves. There are penalty and bonus movement sections of the board.

—user summary

The word “atlas” in everyday language means a collection of maps. But it is in literature the name of a Greek god. It is the product design to theme the narrative of conservation of planet earth in Greek mythology through introducing the titan Atlas who guards the earth by carrying it on his shoulders.

The goal of the card game is to be the first gamer to play all of the cards in your hand in a round, OR to score the highest points accumulated over a certain number of rounds.

We have match cards and action cards.
Match cards are played by matching according to the three elements each match card carries: 
The continent, Africa, Europe, Asia, Americas, Australia & New Zealand; 
The category of living things, land, water, air animals, and plants; and 
The species.
Matching could be done:
Within your own hand; 
Draw from pile; or
Pick up a played card.
Action cards, SKIP, REVERSE, TRADE and ATLAS (Joker) are for strategy moves.

We have end game bonus in the form of: 
Priority in competition for the match card played; and 
Forming an identical pair with another match card, either drawn from pile or played by another player, that is the same in continent and species with the only match card left on hand.

—description from the designer

This football-themed game is an authentic reproduction of a 1950s card game.

Players move the ball about the "pitch" in accordance with the cards the play. While skill in the choice of cards played is important, the element of chance is never lost like in real football.

—user summary

A communicative entertainment game. Each player tells the best one-minute stories based on two given words. The player who can tell the best stories without using a forbidden word gets a chip. The player who has 5 chips first wins. The three terms are determined with three dice.

—user summary

District Commander: ZNO centers on insurgent and counter-insurgent operations and tactics during the Algerian War of Independence. The game deals unflinchingly with the weapons with which this war was fought – terror cells, double agents, the forced resettlement of ethnic and religious groups – prompting uneasy questions about how governments obtain, hold, and use power.

Brian Train's District Commander is a series of operational games on counterinsurgency situations. The players alternate activation of groups of units (stacks) to perform discrete operations (missions) through the expenditure of Task Points (TP). Some missions are Tactical Missions - straightforward military tasks such as performing patrols, ambushing or attacking enemy forces, or moving from one place to another - and these may be performed multiple times by a stack during a turn. Other missions emphasize the "non-tactical" end of the campaign, establishing friendly influence, control, and infrastructure in an area, reducing the enemy's claim to the same, and recruiting or training troops. These missions take more time to perform and so unlike the tactical missions may be the only mission performed by the stack during the turn.

Missions are resolved by play of secretly-held Chance Chits, each with ratings that are better or worse for certain types of operations. Chits are played simultaneously and the ratings compared, modified by units, assets, and the current board state to determine the outcome. Using the right chit at the right time - knowing when to save a good chit for later and when to use it, and trying to determine if your opponent is going all-in or holding back - will require steely judgment in an atmosphere of doubt and deception.

All this is done in pursuit of objectives handed down to you by your superiors (i.e., chosen randomly) and kept secret from your opponent - objectives that may even change over the course of the game. Within this framework, the two sides - Government and Insurgent - play very differently, with the Insurgent player, in particular, depending on bluff and deception to achieve their goals. A large number of variant rules allow you to turn the game into a sandbox for exploring counterinsurgency doctrine and practice.

—description from the publisher

Four animals (lion, bear, kangaroo and penguin) each comes in 6-fold. At first cursory glance, they all look the same and you have to look closely to see that the lion has swapped its crown for sunglasses. Only two animals of each species are really identical and those are the ones to find. But to do this, you can't just look at the animal discs, you have to rearrange the piles of discs according to precisely specified rules.

—user summary

Horseland: Saut d'obstacle, Horseland Show Jumping

Welcome to the Horseland Ranch!
Meet Sarah, Rosa, Marie and all their friends and get ready for the funniest show jumping competition you have ever entered. 

Goal:
Complete the show jumping course as quickly as possible, accumulating as few penalties as possible.

Gameplay:
Players use the colored horseshoes to move matching their color with the board colors. Placing them on the board first, then moving horse and rider along the path created.
Horseshoes played are then removed.
Unused horseshoes are placed in the equestrian school and can be used by other players.
When players jump an obstacle for the first time they put a bar of their color, but must neigh every time, or they lose their bar.

Win:
When a player has placed the 10 bars she/he is done, other players continue until they got rid of their 10 bars.

—user summary

Build your garden and collect your favorite flower Set to win the game. Gain resources and income to bloom and do evil scheme to sabotage your neighbors.

Flower Garden is a gardening game for 2-4 players ages 12+. It is a light-mid weight game and can last for 30 -60 min.

In order to win the game you need to collect 4 of the same color of flowers in your own garden. However there are exactly 4 cards of the same color in the flower deck (Total of 20 flower cards with 5 different color set). In order to collect the flower you need, you would have to sabotage, steal, or change color of your flower.

Before owning flowers, you have to go through the process of gaining seeds and blooming them with resources.
You may sell the flowers to gain income for plan cards. Plan cards will help your garden and/or destroy your neighbors.

To add a twist in the game, there is a Queen card that has 2 different personalities: Flower Queen and Weed Queen. One card with 2 sides. Flower Queen is definitely the queen you need in your garden, you would not want to have Weed Queen destroying your garden. To summon the queen in a garden, a player prays for the queen by scarifying a flower or pay the coins. If another player prays for the queen, she will be moving around different garden depending on the prayer choice.

The game ends as soon as the first player successfully collected 4 colors of the same flower.

—description from designer

Welcome to the world of Big Pig! Here a bunch of cute and hungry critters live in a house with their family.

The family has left for the day. This is the perfect chance to raid the kitchen! Help Big Pig and friends eat all of the delicious food! If the family comes back before the food is eaten, they’ll surely stop the feast. Got to make it quick!

Each player picks a character to play as and puts the character card in front of them. Then the team of players pick a meal based on difficulty (breakfast for easy, lunch for medium, and dinner for hard). Each meal is a different board with four foods displayed that the players must consume. Each of the foods has 16 tiles that are placed on top of them and each tile has a value. When playing the game, players will munch the foods and be able to remove a total value of tiles equal to their character's hunger value.

Each round a "bad things" card is played. These are events that make the food harder to eat either by having a one time effect or an effect that lasts the whole round. Then the players take their turns, taking one action at a time, and going clockwise. Each character card has 4 actions. To take an action, place a "snack token" on one of the four available actions that does not already have a snack token, and take the action described in that spot. These actions can involve things like munching the food, obtaining an item card for a bonus, or playing a card. When munching a food, remove the tiles from the food board and place them on your character card. The food tiles munched can be used to boost your action cards later. Each action card has a unique effect if it is boosted. After a player takes their turn by performing an action, that player draws action cards up to their hand size.

Play continues until each player has performed their four actions for the turn. Then the car moves forward one space on the game board. If the car reaches the house, the family has returned and stops the feast! All of the players lose. If the car didn't reach the house, players play another round. If at any point the players consume all of the food tiles off of one food, they receive a bonus card that effects each player and gives them a boost. If The players consume every food tile on each of the foods on the whole board, the players immediately win the game!

—description from designer

Feel the need for speed!

"A Pilot's War" is a free, pnp, solo game, which allows you to step into the cockpit of a Fighter jet and experience the thrill of conducting combat missions above enemy territory.

The base game includes two planes, the F-14 Tomcat and the Panavia Tornado. You will fly bombing missions above the Red Sea and Eastern Germany. Survive 20 missions and earn ranks and medals.

This fast paced, action focused game was inspired by Gregory M. Smith's "The Hunters" and Markus Salo's "F-14 Tomcat" and brings the narrative-driven games into the jet age.

STRIFULL tells about the period of the Heretic Wars on the continent of Auslend, in the universe of Strained Kingdoms.

Choose your side, feel yourself on the battlefield amid swords, shields, storms and energetic explosions, and achieve glorious victory…or your own destruction.

Each of the factions has 60 Troop Cards (3 copies of 20 cards), 3 Leader Cards, 4 Tokens (representing the Elemental Stones) and 1 Die. In STRIFULL, players compete against each other while taking on the mantle of one of the Leaders of the chosen faction, crafting strategies and combos to beat the opponent!

Your cards are organized in two 3x3 grids, with your leader character in between them. Each of them has a specific role in the game, one being used to attack your opponent while the other is meant to defend your clan. In your turn, you will move your troops and your leader, use your leader's abilities, recruit new soldiers and engage in battle with the opponent in order to exterminate their lines. The first player to completely overpass all of the opponent's lines is the winner!

—user summary

Of the plethora of galaxies in the universe, seven of them are primordial. In them are found the Seven Stones of Creation, responsible for all existing power, providing the energy, vitality and balance necessary for everything to exist. The greed for possession of these stones corrupts villages, fuels wars and smolders the sense of justice of those who protect them.

Seven Galaxies is a card game with the theme of intergalactic wars that brings with it new experiences and infinite possibilities, in a universe never seen before. Each player assembles his army in his own way and has the objective of destroying the opponent's fortress to win the battle. For this, there will be several creatures and other auxiliary cards, thus being able to neutralize the enemy and reach its objective. Plays depend on two things: level and energy. Level is what will be used for summoning cards and energy is basically used to activate effects.

During your turn, you will rise your level up, summon creatures, evolve, equip, activate your creatures' abilities to attack your opponent's troops and fortress. The first player to completely destroy the other's fortress wins the game, becoming the most powerful clan in the universe.

The NTSB (National Transportation Safety Board) needs your help!

Assignment: travel the world, solve aeronautic crashes, and resolve diplomatic emergencies. Your team's challenge? Completing 10 missions within 10 turns. You will be scored on the quality of your success

Join Miranda Chase and other great characters from M.L. Buchman's techno-thriller novel series in an interactive global aeronautic investigation game! Build a cooperative team of air-crash investigators, select a mission difficulty, and coordinate global travel with your team each turn to determine the best strategy for solving every crisis... but remember: even the finest plans face the roll of the dice!

Players control multiple characters while moving to various locations.  Each game consists of 10 missions which the players must try to solve. The final score is computed based on the number of solved and unsolved missions, flight cards, and time zones.

Build your own gang and customize it to suit your plans. Gather resources to complete heists and money to recruit new gang members. And make sure you escape the police! A unique and fun game from the award-winning designers of Automania and Trails of Tucana.

Bad Company supports up to 6 players with very little downtime. It also includes a solo mode where you try to outsmart the police.

Each player has a player board with 11 gang members. You may upgrade them by placing overlapping cards onto them. This way, the visual appearances of your gang members change as they gain more abilities.

Each round, the active player rolls four dice and divides them into two pairs (pay coins to reroll). Each pair of dice activates one gang member on the active player's board.  All other players may use one of the pairs to activate a single gang member on their own boards.

Activating a gangster provides resources needed to complete heists, money to upgrade your gang members, or advance your car through the city. 
You want to advance your car, because you need to stay ahead of the police in order to collect loot along the city route.

You gain points by completing heists, upgrading your gang and by driving your car through the city.
Some completed heists provide special abilities which you can build your strategy around.

The game ends when a player completes their 6th heist, or when any car reaches the dock on the city track, and the player with the most points wins.

—description from designer

Alpujarras Express is a super quick adaptation of Alpujarras.  The game consists of 30 game cards that are laid out in a path.  It also contains 2 "farmer" cards which, when folded, can stand up and act as pawns.

Players move their farmers along the path and pick up fruit, coins, or market cards.  The market cards are used at the end of the game to "sell" the fruits acquired, so players are trying to pick up market cards that match their fruit cards, while also trying to prevent the opponent from doing the same.

The farmer with the most coins at the end of the game, wins.

The Battle of the Nile, also known as the Battle of Aboukir Bay, was a major naval battle fought between the British Royal Navy and The First French Republic Navy on August 1-3, 1798, at Aboukir Bay, on the Egyptian Mediterranean coast.

This volume also contains The Battle of Algeciras Bay, the Battle of Lake Erie, and the battles of the American super frigate USS Constitution.

Box contents:

27 ship miniatures
90 removable sails (81 + 9 extras)
9 boards (297 x 210 mm)
1 rules book
2 turns and tables player aids
6 reference cards
3 counter sheets
1 sheet of stickers
6 six-sided dice
1 scenario book

Miniatures are supplied unpainted and some assembly may be required.

A co-op game where players try to fulfill missions in order to lead their characters to the campsite before the storm breaks.

Players move their characters by doing acting, explaining and drawing. If the task fails, the players get 1 point, for a good performance the players get 2 points and for an exceptional performance they get 3 points. Points are then spent to draw movement tiles, which are then used to move.

The game is a race to finish. Players win if they reach the end of the track and lose if there are three thunder tokens on the board. Thunder tokens are added depending on the cards drawn from the weather deck after each turn.

The aim of the game is to get the players to know each other better. The game is sold to support foster care families in Finland.

—user summary

The new Family Edition contains 200 questions that challenge all family members and call for an enjoyable competition.

There are ten possible answers to each question, and every player gets to answer every question.
If the answer is correct, the player gets an answer marker.
But should you answer or pass?
If you don't score your answer markers on time (and thereby pass on this round), you can end up losing them.
So if you are not 100% certain of an answer - do you gamble or do you pass?

Labyrinth: Paths of Destiny is an adventure & fantasy board game for 2-6 players, in which they become ancient explorers and builders of a magical 3D labyrinth and at the same time epic heroes trying to reach its middle to gain immortality using incredible powers and found artifacts. There can only be one winner of this race.

In order to win, players must secure the key to the central chamber and be the first to reach this chamber while avoiding the Keeper (Golem), traps, monsters and other players.

During the game, with each turn you can take any 2 of the following actions:

     Basic: move the hero, build the labyrinth, leave traps, use the abilities of your hero or items,
     Special (once per turn): move the Keeper of the Labyrinth, move a Monster, evoke powerful events,
     Situational: climb or descend a bridge, fight another player.


—description from the publisher

Put down the right colour without getting in a muddle!
"With blue but without yellow". Be the quickest to put down a card that respects the colour combination shown by the two dice.

Kezao is a speed game that calls on one's sense of observation of the colours displayed on a picture. Players must find a card in their game, compatible with the colour indications, present or absent, displayed on the dice. The aim of the game is to be the first to discard all of one's cards.

The players roll their figure over a course towards the finish line. Advantages and disadvantages lurk along the way. A restart may also become necessary. The first player to reach the finish line exactly wins the game.

—user summary

It's time for the annual Festival of Wizardry and Witchcraft! Battle against the best wizards and witches in the world to prove you can mix the best potions and become this year's winner!

At the start of Elixir Mixer, each player has a hand of five ingredient cards. The elixir cards and ten bonus cards are placed on the table, with six random ingredient cards next to them as a market. On a turn, take one of three possible actions:


    Draw a card from the deck.
    Take a card from the market, then refill the market.
    Place one card from your hand into the market, then take any number of cards so long as their sum equals the card placed, then refill the market.


If you have several cards of the same color in your hand and their total value corresponds to the value of the top elixir card of that color, you can discard these cards to collect that elixir. You can create several elixirs in the same turn. End your turn by seeing whether you can claim one of the bonus cards by meeting the depicted requirements, such as an elixir or each color or three purple elixirs. Each collected elixir and bonus card is worth 1 point, and whoever collects 8 points first wins.

2 years ago, we introduced true "Reverse Deck-building" to the world in the form of Shake Up. Today and for the first time ever, we introduce the concept of true "Shared Deck-building" - Everyone plays on the same single deck with the same hand, and yes everyone has a part in building this same single deck.

In the Azure Peninsula, civilization has not tamed the breathtaking yet deadly nature it offers. Isle whales would crush entire towns in their passing, and river wyrms swallow whole camps. Yet every so often, a tiny hamlet or a cosy little village would spring up atop a hill. In our story, the village chief has just passed on, leaving a chaotic mess of younger heads to run the place. The Tool Master needs stone to craft useful items for everyone, while the Culinary Chief feeds the group, the Scouting Lead goes out with his party to patrol and scour for materials, and the Commander protects the walls and its inhabitants.

They are but a tiny settlement with limited people. How will the different leaders work together to utilize their resources? Too much of one resource will cause some leaders to not be able to do what they have to do, and too little of anything could spell doom for everyone. A single deck represents the village, and players take on the roles of the various leaders. They must balance their own needs with those of other leaders in order to survive and thrive amidst a harsh land. Every leader is important!

—description from the publisher

In 1923 the bootlegger Owney Madden acquired an establishment in Harlem, New York, and named it the "Cotton Club". His idea was to use it as a cover to sell alcohol during Prohibition, but the place grew in popularity, and talented artists such as Duke Ellington, Louis Armstrong, Ethel Waters, and Cab Calloway turned it into a jazz mecca.

In 1923 Cotton Club, you will oversee a club during the complex times of Prohibition. To smuggle in alcohol, you will have to look for partners in the criminal world and invest money to hire artists and improve your club. All to attract the most important and influential celebrities of the era...

1923 Cotton Club is played over a maximum of six rounds in which the players can use three pawns to select between different actions: make improvements, ask for a loan, get a tip-off, associate with gangsters, smuggling, hire artists and attract celebrities. All to collect more reputation than all the other clubs in New York! The player with the most reputation points at the end wins.

Life on a space station can be an exhilarating experience. That can all change in an instant when things go awry.

You are part of the space station's crew when all heck breaks loose. With limited access to supplies and weapons your only hope is to make it to the escape pods. Unfortunately, the way there is riddled with blocked passages and invaders looking to destroy you. Finding the escape pod access areas is your only hope!

As the crew, you must run the corridors, gather supplies, and locate the escape pods while fighting off the invaders. It is your choice how you play. Do you all work together, is it an all out fight to escape, or do you use your fellow crew to find the pods and then abandon them.

Players roll to move through the station, discovering new sections and paths, items to use and encounters to battle or avoid.

Game ends when 1 player reaches an escape pod, all do, or the station is destroyed. Depends on how the players choose to setup the game.

Heckin Hounds is a 2-7 player trick-taking game exploring the perils of professional dog walking in the Underworld.

Players are given the task of walking Hades' collection of hounds. Do your job too well, and she'll promote you to management - a responsibility feared throughout the realm. Do your job too poorly, and you'll be demoted to professional dog food instead.

The game is played with your hand facing outward, giving you no knowledge of the hounds you have. Every round has a different player serving as the shift leader, who can see both their hand and everyone else’s. The shift leader gives each player three clues as to the hounds they are holding - how helpful, useless, or beguiling the clue is up to you, but they must be true. The shift leader also assigns Cerberus to a player, a trump card pup that wins any trick he shows up to.

Players have a few opportunities to try and manage their luck, and must promise how many shifts they will work (tricks they will take) based on the limited information they have of their own hand, and the hands of the other players they can see. Cards are played, tricks are won, and a new round begins. After everyone has taken a turn as the shift leader, the game is over. The player who scored the least without going negative did the least amount of work without being fired, and wins the game!

Thus, Heckin Hounds is a game of being barely adequate.

—description from the publisher

A small game of picking tiles.

You will have to do a 5x5 board with number from 1 to 10 in 5 colors.

But before pickup you only see the back of the tile, who only shows to you, a choice between 2 colors, and 5 numbers. The more the game advance, the more the guessing is easy.

In each line and column, you will be compared to opponent at the the end of the game, scoring combinations are like in poker. But only the better of both will score the line/column!

The game ends when all tiles are all used.  The winner is the player with the best score.

A fun board game Secrets of the Pharaohs. Learn hieroglyphs and have fun discovering the secrets of the pharaohs.

On board place tiles face down tile side is with alphabet letters and face up with hieroglyphs. There is reference what letter is with which hieroglyphs, but game encouraged to remember pairs as players can only see side with hieroglyphs.

2 to 4 players starts from middle of board. Rolling a die and move by exact rolled number. Goal is to collect letters and form word with 3 or up to 6 letters, and it's scored accordingly.
First player to score 20+ points win.



"Zabavna društvena igra Tajne faraona. NauÄite hijeroglife i ludo se zabavljajte otkrivajuÄ‡i tajne faraona".
Opis dizajnera.

The Struggle for Dominance over Space Sector Control.

At start players receive game money which is used to buy buildings represented by tokens and soldiers standees. Before battle in turn sequence starts players can use start money to make their beginning camp and units.

Players also received a mission which by completing it brings player more money for purchasing more soldiers and more buildings.
Every building and every soldier have their own special abilities and unique movement and fire power and range. On players turn, any time during a turn player may buy new units as well as new buildings.

Buildings may be place anywhere on board but units must be placed in headquarters. Forget to say that during setup headquarters must be built. It is suggested to protect HQ with building and units also during setup.

Player then on same turn may activate any and all soldiers standee with up to two actions like move, fire or special actions.
Also any time mission conditions are met, reveal it, take reward and draw new mission card (keep it secret from other player).
Game and triggers in two ways. First by defeating enemy HQ and surviving player takes win. Second way is when one player no longer have money to buy new units and have no units/soldiers in play. That player lose.



Borba za prevlast nad kontrolom sektora svemira.

The Sensual deck helps players overcome shyness and introduces variety into the bedroom. Your romantic life will be even more exciting and full of passion.

This deck is delicate and sensual — a perfect way to get to know each other better, open up, and spend a wonderful evening together, leading to pleasure for both of you.

The deck contains 55 cards with various tasks, challenges and undressing cards, which may be freely mixed with the Passionate and Spicy deck. Each card is illustrated using fine erotic photography and inspirational quotes.

The game ends when one of the players (the game was designed for an unlimited number of players, but of course it will be played mostly by couples) is naked and an "arcana" card is played. That player loses the game.

NOTE: It's a reimplementation of Arkana MiÅ‚oÅ›ci. Not only the graphics changed, but also a lot of cards were added/removed/changed.

The Collector's Box features upgraded components but also more game play content that won't be in the retail version.

There will be more characters, more cards, and different variants of the same components such as metal coins.



Over the years, a lively town has fallen into ruin. Disturbing stories that surround Bedeville can send shivers down your spine. One of them, often considered the most real, tells a tale of Mr. Carl - a grave keeper and a grim owner of a local theme park.Mr. Carl arrived in Bedeville back when life and happiness bloomed in every corner of this little town. As a juggler and later - grave digger in a nearby graveyard, he barely made the ends meet. How did he get the fortune that let him create a theme park? We will probably never learn. Some think that he made a pact with a malignant, and fun-loving Trickster. That’s the only explanation for what happened next, including the nightmare, that led Bedeville to its downfall. Citizens were forced to leave this grim place while Mr. Carl ended up doomed to eternal torment. What kind of torment? Having his theme park be visited by “unique” guests like the undead from the nearby graveyard. Additionally, to make Mr. Carl even angrier, they’re invited every night by the ticket seller, who opens the grounds of Bedeville Carnival when dusk arrives.

This is where your adventure begins. As corpses from the nearby graveyard, you will visit the crazy attractions of the theme park. It doesn’t matter when and how you ended up in this burial ground. Each night an eerie force makes you wake up from the eternal slumber and feel alive again. Each night you will discover new attractions and collect Souvenirs before they’ll get grabbed by grave digger’s mean cat called Fleabag. But beware! Mr. Carl can catch you anytime and chase you back to the cemetery.

The game is played in consecutive player turns. Each player has the goal of collecting the most Joy Markers and Souvenirs sold in the local Booths. When all Souvenirs end up being sold to the players - the game concludes. The player, who at the end has the most victory points awarded for their Joy Markers and Souvenirs collected, becomes the winner.

Every Player picks their favorite undead unafraid of any, even the most dangerous Attractions. Next, you draw the crazy Attractions that the characters will move through during the game. By visiting more and more Attractions and performing Actions from the Attractions you will attempt to outsmart your graveyard friends. By using Actions in a smart way a Player will attempt to hold their position on a specific Attraction. Only this way they will be able to buy Souvenirs next turn. At the end of each turn, a player draws one Trickster’s token from the bag and checks what destiny has for them in-store. Attractions generate Noise Markers. The more Noise, the bigger the chance that the Attractions will make the grave keeper arrive and chase the player’s character back to the graveyard.

The Spicy Deck is best for those looking for intense experiences, helping you fulfill fantasies related to possessive domination and arousing submission, also by using sensual gadgets. This game fires up hidden passions and desires.

This deck is ideal for those who wish to feel in total control, empowered or dominated, and who wish to fulfill more specific and refined fantasies.

The deck contains 55 cards with various tasks, challenges and undressing cards, which may be freely mixed with the Passionate and Spicy decks. Each card is embellished with fine erotic photography and inspirational quotes.

The game ends when one of the players (the game was designed for an unlimited number of players, but of course it will be played mostly by couples) is naked and an "arcana" card is played. That player loses the game.

NOTE: It's a reimplementation of Arkana MiÅ‚oÅ›ci: Dominacja. Not only the graphics changed, but also a lot of cards were added/removed/changed.

In Gravwell, players command spaceships that have been pulled through a black hole, transporting them into a different dimension. With each ship lacking fuel to get home, each player must collect basic elements from surrounding asteroids, using the gravity of the dimension and what little resources they have in order to reach the warp gate that will take them home. But in this dimension, moving ships will travel towards the nearest object, which is usually another ship, and when those objects are moving either forward or backward, reaching the warp gate isn't always easy. Time is running out to save your crew and your ship! As a grim reminder of the cost of failing to escape, the frozen hulks of dead spacecraft litter the escape route — but with careful card play, you can slingshot past these derelict craft and be the first to escape from the Gravwell!

Gravwell uses 26 alphabetized cards to determine movement order and thrust; most cards move your ship towards the nearest object, but a few move you away from it. At the start of each round, players draft fuel cards, picking up three pairs of two cards, with only the top card of each pile being visible; you get some information as to which moves you can expect from the other spaceships, but you won't know which moves you'll be forced to make when you draft your cards!

During a round, each player will play all of their fuel cards in the order of their choosing. During each phase of a round, each player chooses one card, then all cards are revealed and resolved in alphabetical order. When your opponents move in ways you didn't expect, you won't always be heading in the direction you thought you would! Each player holds an "Emergency Stop" card that they may tactically play only once per round to avoid such a situation.

Whoever first reaches the warp gate wins, but if no one has escaped after six rounds, then the player who is closest to the gate wins.

Gravwell: 2nd Edition features the same gameplay as earlier editions of the game, but now 40 fuel cards are included, which allows up to six players in the game at the same time. (Earlier editions maxed out at four players.) Additionally, ship ability cards are included that can give a unique power to each ship's captain trying to find their way home.

Four farm animals have to reach the stable before sunset and have to cover a distance of 3 fields to do so. In addition, the sun also moves, it has a distance of 8 fields. Whoever's turn it is, rolls the dice and must try to uncover the matching card when an animal is rolled; if you succeed, the animal takes a step and you lay the card out in front of you. For a shamrock rolled, turn over any card and move the animal. If you roll the sun, the animal moves one position. If all animals are in the stable before the sun sets, everyone wins together; the individual winner is the one who has the most animal cards.

—user summary

Plaformer is 2-4 player miniature Board Game introducing light, competitive gameplay that you have never seen before! Climb on platforms, fight monsters, gather gold / points / items and most importantly - race with your friends! This Board Game brings light, extremely FUN experience for family and friends - prepare for tons of laughs and cunning against your opponents!

Platformer is centered around a very simple Gravity Mechanic. During your turn, you climb up – but when your turn ends, you fall down, until you hit a platform or a ladder. Race to the top and try to keep with your opponents!

There’s no one big map in the box. From the cards, you create a new map in every single game. Also, the map has many levels and from the start, you see only one of them.

Every move you may make is determined by the dice. After rolling it you see how many and what moves you can do. You don’t enjoy your result? Don’t worry! Each die may be rerolled once! Back to the actions, it might be a jump, move one space, getting a gold coin, and moving or attacking the monsters. In general, you do not only have to play smart but a little luck is needed too!

It’s time for class at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, but before your lessons can begin, you've got to make it through the arched doors at the top of the school's grand staircase. Will you make it before the stairs fall away from underneath your unpredictable path?

Let the ever-changing staircase in Jenga: Harry Potter put your dexterous skills to the test by carefully removing and replacing blocks towards the door at the top of the tower. Represent your favorite Hogwarts house by choosing one of four color-coded markers representing Gryffindor, Hufflepuff, Slytherin, and Ravenclaw and prepare to make your way to the top. A custom die determines how many blocks to pull and stack as well as the number of stairs you can move your house marker. Watch your steps! If the tower comes crashing down, you'll be late for class and have to rebuild. The first student to reach the top wins and will bring glory to their Hogwarts house.

Murder has occurred! The victim is inspected by a medical examiner while the National Police are called to the crime scene. The police do not know that the Criminal and the Guaremate "accomplice" is among them.

Someone saw the Criminal and the Guaremate at the crime scene. There is a snitch. You and your teammate must work together to reveal the identity of the imposters.

The theme of the game is about investigators and assassins. Where the murderers pose as police but there is a person who knows who the real criminals are.

The game is set in the daily life of the Dominican Republic. Where the weapons have names that the locals assign to them. The game has a heavy jargon used by the Dominicans.

There is a medical examiner who is on the side of the investigators and who can give clues to the investigators. The medical examiner can mark, in a folder, the state of the body, how hard the blow was, where the body suffered the attack, how quickly it died, what was the cause of death.

A player can accuse another player by selecting the weapon and place that the player think are correct. If the player fail then he lost he badge (and cannot accuse any other player).

The game can end in two ways, the first way is after three turns of accusation have passed. Second way is when Investigators find the weapon and the place where the murder occurred.

There are two teams, the team of police officers and investigators and the team of the murderer, his accomplice. The team of investigators wins if they find the weapon and the location of the murder. The teams of the murderer and accomplice win if after three rounds of accusations the investigator does not find the weapon and the place. Another winning condition for the killer team is if the killer finds out who the snitch is.

Beef loving invasive aliens have landed and circled your farm with crop circles!  Marking it as a landing site for an all you can eat beef buffet!!

One team controls the farmers and one controls the aliens! Farmers seek to wrangle their cows back into the barn and put a few pieces of buckshot in the unknown cow thieves. Meanwhile the aliens seek to capture the cows, mind control pesky farmers and lead the cows back to their UFOs!

Whoever gets 4 cows first, wins.

NOW ON KICKSTARTER!

On the Ides of March 44 BCE; Julius Caesar was assassinated. In the power vacuum, you vie for control of the Roman Republic. With no clear leader in place, the Senate awards Imperium Maius to one of your rivals. You must scheme, conspire and backstab to increase your Imperium. The Senate will observe the shifts in power and grant Imperium Maius to the most powerful leader. At last, the Senate will be forced to concede, one leader has an insurmountable amount of Imperium! The Roman Empire will be born and a new Caesar will be crowned! Will it be you?

44 BCE is a rotating all-on-one strategy game. In this dramatic, emotion provoked, immersive gameplay, you are one of five suitors, Agrippa, Brutus, Cleopatra, Mark Antony, or Octavian, competing to become the first Emperor of Rome. Each year, the Imperium Maius will compete against the Suitors to maintain control of the republic.

To succeed, you must collaborate with the other suitors but remain on the lookout for every opportunity to gain an advantage over your fellow competitors and slash them down. If you succeed, the Senate will declare you Imperium Maius for the next year.

After clashing it out over six years (rounds), the player with the most Imperium will be anointed the first Roman Emperor!

Return to the nostalgic (and sometimes painful) schoolyards of youth to battle it out at recess in a cutthroat game of tag.
Hype Tag is an innovative, addictively re-playable strategy card game for 2-4 hipsters ages 13 and up.

To win, be the first player to get up to 10 on your hype meter, flip it over, and then go back down to 1. You gotta GET HYPED by making impressive tags and creating mischief on the playground... but then you need to have enough self-control to SIMMER DOWN and go back to class!

Hype Tag features the unique interaction of two different decks of cards. The HYPE deck has the strategic depth of a trading card game while the TAG deck has the simple fun of a classic card game. It's like if Magic and Uno had a baby.

A unique aspect of Hype Tag is the hype mechanic. Each HYPE card has a number in the upper corner and you must at that number (or higher) on your hype meter to play the card. Many cards also have a bonus, granting an even more powerful effect the higher you get. But... when you flip your meter over and start moving back down, your dwindling hype prevents you from getting bonuses and eventually makes some hype cards unplayable. So you have to be crafty and a little bit cutthroat to win. The game ends when the first player gets back down to 1.

Be sure to manage your hand carefully because you have to play a tag card to tag an an opponent at the end of each turn. If you can't, you have to call a time out which rewards the other players. In 3 and 4 player games, Hype Tag has a unique non-standard turn order which gives players a choice about who to tag. And this choice carries strategic implications.

The game also include "Sass" cards that block and copy the actions of others, trait bonuses that reward certain styles of play, and Older Kids - special character cards you receive when you reach 10 on your hype meter - that grant powerful abilities aiding your descent back down to 1.

It is great casual fun that also stands up to very intense tournament style play.

Lingolandia is a family game that fosters creativity and vocabulary. You can play in various languages!

In Lingolandia, players draw a random letter from the bag and roll the die to determine what kind of round this will be. There are two different types of rounds - a player's own round or a crazy joined round where all players play together. All players are always involved even on another player's turn.

Then players use their imagination as well as observation to find words on displayed cards. Each card provides various interpretations while also providing visual objects to allow players to focus on searching and observing the illustrations.

Players take turns drawing a random letter from a bag and rolling the die. The die will determine if they are going to play an individual round or a joined round where all players guess the words simultaneously.

The die roll will also indicate the number of words that a player has to find on the face-up illustrated cards. Words must start with the selected letter and can be actually present on the cards, or players can use their imagination based on the illustrations.

If the die roll shows a balloon (the Lingolandia logo), then all players guess at the same time--providing a very interactive round of play.

Correctly guessed words are awarded points which are recorded on the road to the finish line on the board. The first player that gathers enough points to cross the finish line is the winner.

Each player represents a tennis player at the height of their career and will have to defeat their opponents using well-researched plays and keen intuition. In this intense game of attack and counterattack, to execute the perfect shot, players must be able to respond to the opponent's.

Game Set Match is the result of CODEC, a Portuguese card game contest organized by the publisher Art and Games, board game café "A jogar é que a gente se entende" and the project "Board Game Friendly".

Players receives 7 stroke cards
The court card and the cards that define the “Game Flow” are placed in the center of the table.

The serving player receives the service card he places on the table, visible to everyone, and receives an extra card for his hand. It then chooses a beat from among the cards in his hand and places it on the table (player play line), advancing one position in Game Flow.

To respond, the opponent will have to place on the table a card or set of cards with reactions that correspond to the opponent's hit. Each of the three symbols to the left of a card are reactions: the ball's effect, the type of hit, and the field zone. After choosing the reaction cards, the player must move the Game Flow according to the number of reactions that matched the opponent's hit.
The last card placed on the play line (rightmost card) is considered his hit to be reacted by the opponent.

Players continue to alternately Match the opponent's hits until one of the players manages to reveal the number 4 in Game Flow, thus ending the Point.

The first player to reach the 4th point (15-30-40-game) wins the game, the set and the match.

Cada jogador representa um tenista no auge da sua carreira e terá que derrotar os seus oponentes com recurso a jogadas bem estudadas e uma intuição apurada. Neste jogo intenso de ataque e contra-ataque, para executar a pancada perfeita os jogadores têm de conseguir responder à do adversário.

Game Set Match é o resultado do CODEC, concurso de jogo de cartas Português organizado pela editora Art and Games, board game café "A jogar é que a gente se entende" e o projecto "Board Game Friendly".

Os jogadores recebem 7 cartas de batidas
A carta court e a as cartas que definem o Game Flow são colocadas no centro da mesa.

Cada Ponto começa com um Serviço:
Serviço
O jogador que serve recebe a carta serviço que coloca na mesa, visível para todos, e recebe uma carta extra para a sua mão. Em seguida, escolhe uma batida de entre as cartas da sua mão e coloca na mesa (a sua linha de jogo), avançando uma posição no Game Flow.

Para responder, o adversário terá que colocar na mesa uma carta ou conjunto de cartas com reações que correspondem à batida do adversário. Cada um dos três símbolos à esquerda de uma carta são as reações: o efeito da bola, o tipo de pancada e a zona do campo. Após escolha das cartas de reação, o jogador deve mover o Game Flow de acordo com o número de reações que fizeram match com a batida do adversário.
A última carta colocada na Linha de Jogo (carta mais à direita) é considerada a sua batida para ser respondida pelo adversário.

Os jogadores continuam a fazer Match alternadamente às batidas do adversário até que um dos jogadores consiga revelar o número 4 no Game Flow, assim terminando o Ponto.

O primeiro jogador a atingir o 4º ponto, vence o jogo, o set e o match.

Is a COOP survival game.
You have 30 days to build a shelter with a help cooperation and building materials.
There is going to be dangers ahead, polution, natural disasters and not a lot of smalltalk.

You and your friends are adventurers, planning to go treasure hunting in Egypt. Everyone has some treasure maps, but you can't go alone. So you guys decide to help each other, even though the helper will decide who claims the treasure. You look forward to collecting the highest value treasure.

Treasure hunting begins now! Each player get 5 cards. The active player plays 1 card face-down from their hand and gives it to another player. The chosen player chooses to either "Receive" or "Reject". The card will be resolved. The next player will become the new active player.

The end of the round is triggered when at least 1 of these conditions occurs:
1. There is only 1 player left (not having a card in hand doesn't matter).
2. Win by the effect of the card.
3. Any player who has a total value of 7 on the cards wins.
4. When everyone has no cards in hand, the players with the highest total value on their cards wins. If there is a tie, all the tied players win.

Talisman: Harry Potter combines the familiar game play of Talisman with the familiar characters from the Harry Potter book series.

Lord Voldemort awaits the most competent of witches and wizards for a fateful demonstration of bravery or obedience in Talisman Harry Potter. Take on the daring roles of members of the Order of the Phoenix or Death Eaters in a fleeting race to gain access to the Dark Lord himself. Meet and present him with one of the Deathly Hallows as a dutiful Death Eater... or use it to defeat the leader once and for all.
